hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When a major negative news catalyst (e.g., large liquidation event, macro scare) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day avg), but the subsequent 4-hour period shows a) price consolidation within ±0.5% of the post-drop low, and b) a >15% drop in 1-hour realized volatility vs. the drop-hour, a long entry on the break above the 4-hour consolidation high will yield a mean-reverting move back toward the pre-news VWAP within 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp negative catalysts in neutral/bull regimes often trigger overreaction. A rapid volatility compression post-shock suggests selling exhaustion and latent bid absorption. The break of consolidation signals trapped shorts covering and momentum reversal.
entry_conditions: 1-hour BTC candle closes >3% down on volume >150% of 20-day avg
Next 4-hour period: price range < ±0.5% from post-drop low
1-hour realized volatility in consolidation period drops >15% from drop-hour volatility
Entry: Buy stop order at consolidation high + 0.1%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Pre-news 4-hour VWAP (calculated from 4 hours before catalyst)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean reversion fails >60% of the time; price continues trending beyond stop-loss in >40% of signals; or profit factor <1.2 in backtest.
